title: EU-Central America Dialogues on Sustainable Food Systems: Building Strategic Partnerships for Resilience and Sustainability
executive_summary: The European Union (EU) and Central America are collaborating to transition towards sustainable food systems, recognizing the significant impact of food systems on climate change and biodiversity loss. The dialogues aim to foster constructive exchanges and develop bi-regional strategies, focusing on key issues such as healthy soils, sustainable pesticide use, and food loss and waste. The first online workshop took place on March 22-23, 2022, involving policymakers and representatives from both regions, highlighting the importance of strategic partnerships in addressing global food security challenges exacerbated by recent crises. The initiative includes four sub-regional workshops, culminating in a bi-regional conference, reinforcing the commitment to sustainable agricultural practices and cooperation under the existing Association Agreement.
characteristics: The EU-LAC Dialogues focus on accelerating the transition to sustainable food systems through strategic partnerships and constructive exchanges of ideas.
The dialogues involve multiple workshops and a bi-regional conference, emphasizing collaboration between the EU and Central America.
Key topics include sustainable agriculture, food loss and waste, and the sustainable use of pesticides.
The initiative is part of the EU's broader Farm to Fork Strategy and Green Deal, addressing climate change and environmental degradation.
The dialogues aim to strengthen cooperation and identify common priorities between the EU and Central American countries.

Political Actors: Secretariat for Central American Economic Integration
Ministries of Agriculture of the Central American governments
Economic Actors: Central American Bank for Economic Integration

practical_applications: Ongoing EU-Latin America and the Caribbean Dialogues on Sustainable Food Systems, which include a series of workshops and a bi-regional conference aimed at promoting collaboration and sharing best practices.

Established policy dialogues between the EU and Central America focusing on sustainable agriculture and food systems, with participation from EU representatives, Central American governments, and the private sector.
Implementation of the EU Farm to Fork Strategy as part of the Green Deal, which addresses the sustainability of food systems and their impact on climate change and biodiversity.

Active discussions on key elements such as healthy soils, sustainable use of pesticides, and food loss and waste during the workshops, aimed at developing bi-regional strategies for sustainable food systems.
A decade-long Association Agreement between the EU and Central America that facilitates cooperation and exchange in building sustainable food systems.
commitments: Conduct a total of four sub-regional workshops on Sustainable Food Systems.
Hold a bi-regional conference expected to take place at the end of 2022.

commitment_details.text: Conduct a total of four sub-regional workshops on Sustainable Food Systems.
Hold a bi-regional conference expected to take place at the end of 2022.

kpi_list.kpi_text: These Dialogues will consist of a total of four sub-regional workshops, being this first edition with Central America, and concluding with a bi-regional conference expected to take place at the end of 2022.
kpi_list.target_description: Conduct four sub-regional workshops and a bi-regional conference

kpi_list.kpi_text: According to the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC), food systems are currently responsible globally for about one-third of total greenhouse gas emissions.
kpi_list.metric_name: Greenhouse Gas Emissions from Food Systems
kpi_list.target_description: Reduce the contribution of food systems to total greenhouse gas emissions

kpi_list.kpi_text: The Agreement has made it possible to increase exchanges and strengthen cooperation between the two regions.
kpi_list.target_description: Enhance cooperation and exchanges between EU and Central America

kpi_list.kpi_text: The need to work together on the global transition towards Sustainable Food Systems.
kpi_list.target_description: Collaborate on the transition to Sustainable Food Systems

kpi_list.kpi_text: Discussing the issues of healthy soils, sustainable use of pesticides, and food loss and waste as decisive parameters of sustainable food systems.
kpi_list.target_description: Engage in discussions on healthy soils, pesticide use, and food loss and waste

top_actors.name: European Union
top_actors.justification: The European Union is the primary actor in the dialogues, driving the agenda for sustainable food systems and is mentioned frequently throughout the text.

top_actors.name: Secretariat for Central American Economic Integration
top_actors.justification: This organization plays a crucial role in facilitating cooperation between the EU and Central America, and is specifically mentioned as a participant in the dialogues.

top_actors.name: European Commission
top_actors.justification: The European Commission, represented by Sandra Gallina, is pivotal in the dialogues, emphasizing the EU's commitment to sustainable food systems and influencing policy discussions.

top_themes.name: Sustainable Food Systems
top_themes.justification: This theme is central to the document's main message, which focuses on the collaboration between the EU and Central America to promote sustainable food systems. The majority of the content is dedicated to discussing strategies, dialogues, and workshops aimed at achieving sustainability in food production and consumption.

top_themes.name: EU-Latin America and Caribbean Dialogues
top_themes.justification: This theme is crucial as it represents the framework through which the dialogues and workshops are organized. It highlights the strategic partnerships necessary for addressing food system challenges and reflects the commitment of both regions to work together on sustainability.

top_themes.name: Climate Change and Environmental Impact
top_themes.justification: This theme is significant as it addresses the broader context of climate change and its impact on food systems. The document emphasizes the need for cooperation to mitigate these effects, making it a key objective in the discussions and strategies outlined.
